creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Marilyn Tupper Doe
description: low wall with small recessed red entryway along a wide road; a couple of lanterns in entryway; pagoda, trees, and rooftops visible over wall
dimension:
10 11/16 × 9 5/8 in. (27.15 × 24.45 cm) (sight)
36 7/8 × 34 7/8 × 1 1/4 in. (93.66 × 88.58 × 3.18 cm) (outer frame, framed with others: see notes)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twelve Months of Kyoto 京名勝十二月
title: May (The pagoda of Yasaka near Gion)
